title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to help users visualize and manage their sleep debt. This repository provides a simple and intuitive interface to track sleep patterns, calculate sleep debt over time, and potentially offer insights into achieving optimal sleep schedules. The project serves as a demonstration of using TypeScript in a front-end development context, focusing on practical application and data visualization.

title: devboard
description: DevBoard is a full-stack project built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI) to provide a collaborative platform for developers. It leverages React Query for efficient data fetching and caching, offering features for project management and task organization, all while emphasizing a clean and intuitive user interface. This repository showcases best practices for modern web development using these technologies.

title: resume
description: This repository hosts the source code for my resume, built using LaTeX for print-friendly versions and HTML for an online, easily accessible format. It serves as a project demonstrating my skills in document preparation and web development, showcasing my ability to create professional and presentable resumes suitable for various application scenarios.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project showcasing interactive map visualizations built using HTML for the front-end and Python for data processing and backend functionalities (if applicable, assuming data fetching or generation). This repository contains code and resources related to creating dynamic and informative maps for various purposes, focusing on practical application and project-based learning in geographic data representation.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a CRUD application built with Python and Flask, utilizing PostgreSQL for data storage. This project demonstrates a full-stack implementation of create, read, update, and delete functionalities, showcasing best practices for connecting a Python backend with an HTML/CSS frontend, and deploying with shell scripting. It serves as a practical example for learning full-stack web development with Python and related technologies.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a full-stack web application built with Next.js (TypeScript, JavaScript, and CSS) to facilitate secure and transparent voting processes. This project utilizes modern web development practices and focuses on creating a user-friendly and robust platform for managing elections and polls, aligning with principles of accessibility and data integrity.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript-based project that creates a customizable and interactive event calendar using HTML and CSS. This repository provides a foundational framework for building dynamic calendars, allowing users to easily add, manage, and display events with a clean and user-friendly interface. It focuses on providing a flexible and extendable solution for displaying events within a web application.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: IoT Asset Tracking is a Next.js project built with TypeScript, TailwindCSS, and Supabase, designed to track the location and status of assets using IoT devices. This application leverages a modern tech stack to provide a user-friendly interface for monitoring asset data, demonstrating a practical implementation of IoT principles with a focus on scalability and maintainability.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a collaborative project management tool built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. It allows users to brainstorm, organize, and prioritize ideas within a visual Kanban-style board, facilitating efficient team collaboration and project planning. This repository provides a foundation for managing and tracking innovative concepts from inception to execution.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: Ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files, offering a user-friendly interface built with JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and Python. This project provides an efficient way to parse, filter, and display ROS logs, enabling developers to quickly identify and debug issues within their robotic systems. The repository includes shell scripts for setup and execution, focusing on streamlining the log analysis workflow for ROS-based projects.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository houses a web-based interface built with JavaScript, Python (likely for backend/data processing), HTML, and CSS, designed to visualize and interact with data from the Robofleet robotics framework. This project provides a user-friendly dashboard for monitoring robot status, performance metrics, and potentially controlling robot actions, falling under the broader topic of robotics projects and data visualization.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project built using TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, showcasing a modern dashboard implementation. This repository demonstrates best practices for building interactive user interfaces with Next.js, focusing on component-based architecture and leveraging TypeScript for type safety. It serves as a learning resource and template for developing similar dashboard applications.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack project built with TypeScript, Vite, Express.js, and leveraging the Gemini API to create a platform for generating insightful and engaging conversations. This repository showcases a modern web application architecture, utilizing front-end technologies like HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for a user-friendly interface and a robust back-end to handle API interactions and data processing.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a fully functional e-commerce platform built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router) and TypeScript, showcasing a robust shopping experience with modern UI components from Material-UI (MUI). This project demonstrates best practices in type safety, efficient data fetching with React Query, and provides a practical example of building a complex web application leveraging key concepts in e-commerce development.
